--- Cognitive Distortions --- Overgeneralizing Believing a single negative event represents a pattern and drawing overly broad conclusions Mind Reading Assuming you know what others are thinking Fortune Telling Predicting bad things will happen without any real evidence Catastrophizing Viewing small problems as much more serious than they truly are All-or-Nothing Thinking Viewing situations only as good or bad, with no middle ground Negative Mental Filtering Focusing only on the negative parts of a situation, while disregarding the positive Disqualifying the Positive Dismissing or ignoring positive experiences, feedback, or accomplishments Personalization Blaming yourself for events or outcomes that are out of your control Emotional Reasoning Assuming how you feel reflects reality Labelling Assigning labels to yourself or others worry icon
